dl.dd: 15924 covers codes for scripts. The codes for Shavian are and 281. Use whichever is most convenient.
639 covers codes for languages. Shavian is not a language, so you should use the 639 code of the language you are writing, usually "" or "" for English.
RFC 3066 governs the representation of languages and scripts with systems such as HTML. Use "en-shaw".
10646 defines codepoints to use with Shavian between U+10450 and U+1047F, with U+B7 for the naming dot.
